quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Jeans and Protein
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, pair, klein. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This leading American brand of denim jeans, introduced in the mid-1940s, was originally developed for rodeo use.
Denim, the fabric of which classic blue jeans are sewn, is actually made from what?
The ‘Scotch Whisky Act 1988’ legally defines Scotch whisky. Which of these is the standard that whisky must meet in order to be called, Scotch Whisky?

options.text: It must be distilled at a Scottish distillery.
It must have an alcoholic strength of less than 94.8% by volume.
It must be matured in Scotland in oak casks for not less than three years.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: This popular cocktail, usually garnished with a cherry, contains rye or bourbon whiskey mixed with sweet vermouth.
This is one of the earliest cultivated foods. The protein in these nuts is very much like the protein in human breast milk. This makes it suitable for inclusion in baby foods.
In 1970, Elio Fiorucci showed designer jeans for the first time in which city?
After retiring from the US Presidency in 1797, this person became one of the most successful American distillers of whiskey.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Washington

questions.question: The first label, which was sewn on the outside of a pair of  jeans in 1936, represented what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A red flag

questions.question: This oil is said to be the richest natural source of vitamin E. It is widely used in cosmetics as an anti-ageing substance.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wheat germ oil

questions.question: The European company Diesel, producing jeans and other clothing, was founded in which country?
This model is famous for her provocative series of Calvin Klein jeans ads in the 1990s and for posing nude in an advertisement for Calvin Kleins perfume brand.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kate Moss

questions.question: In 1853, this jeans producer started the first denim clothing business, intended to supply the miners in California with strong clothing.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Levi Strauss

questions.question: The origin of the word denim is related to the name of which southern French city?
On a Gap Jeans commercial in 2003, Madonna appeared together with which famous American rapper?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Missy Elliott

questions.question: Why were Levis original blue jeans sewn with orange thread?

options.text: Because it matched the color of the copper rivets
Because the orange thread was cheaper
Because the orange thread was the strongest available

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Because it matched the color of the copper rivets

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Chocolate and Source
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, slogan, acid. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This nut is also a source of folic acid, which diminishes the risk of birth defects and heart diseases. It is often combined with chocolate.
This green vegetable is number one on the list of foods that contain agents preventing cancer. The list contains about 30 such agents.

One of the characters in this 2000 movie, Vianne, opens a chocolaterie in a small, old-fashioned French village and sells confections, which inspire the conservative inhabitants of the village and revive their passions.  Name the movie.

Name the American author of children’s literature, poetry and prose who made the following observation regarding chocolate: Strength is the capacity to break a chocolate bar into four pieces with your bare hands - and then eat just one of the pieces.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Judith Viorst

questions.question: Age-related macular degeneration, cancer, heart diseases and neural-tube defects are all diseases which this green leafy vegetable will help you with, as a preventive measure. It is also a good source of iron.
Before raw, unprocessed chocolate becomes suitable for eating, It has to be stirred and kneaded using equipment with rollers, in a process called what?
The scientific name of the evergreen tree cacao, the source of cocoa and chocolate, is Theobroma Cacao. What does ‘Theobroma’ mean in Greek?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ‘food of the gods’

questions.question: A lilac colored cow is the symbol of this brand of chocolate, a best-seller for Kraft Foods, created in 1901 in Neuchâtel, Switzerland by chocolatier Philippe Suchard.
This is one of the few non-fish oils that contains linolenic acid, an omega-3 fatty acid. This will lower your chances of having a heart disease. It also contains no cholesterol.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Soybean oil

questions.question: This food was invented in 1890 by a doctor, for his patients with decayed teeth. Before the 1960s it was hardly consumed outside America, as the rest of the world did not relish it.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Peanut butter

questions.question: While the seed kernels of this plant are a rich source of vitamin E and its sprouts are highly nutritious, its petals are poisonous. The kernels are used for the production of oil.

Famous also as Chinese gooseberry, this fruit is the richest in vitamins and minerals. However, it should not be served with dairy products, as its enzyme actinidin will start dissolving the milk proteins and leave a bitter taste in your mouth.
Besides containing vitamin E, this fruit also has many carotenoids, especially Beta-carotene, which helps you cope with harmful sun rays.
Name the 1994 movie, directed by Robert Zemeckis, in which the main character compared life to a box of chocolates.
Complete this slogan which advertises a candy bar: A _______ a day helps you work, rest and play

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Milk and People
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, chefs, mean. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Freezing does not change the structure of milk.
Pommes de terre is a French term literally translated as apples of the earth.  In English the term refers to which of the following?
Chefs James Beard and Julia Child were lifelong friends.
What does the word epicure mean?

options.text: a person who oversees all operations in a restaurant
a person who works in the wine industry
a gourmet with extensive knowledge of food and wine

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a gourmet with extensive knowledge of food and wine

questions.question: To decant means to pour wine (or other liquid) from one container to another.
How many calories does whole milk contain per serving of 8 fluid ounces?
How many glasses of milk is recommended for people 50+ each day?
Which of these types of chocolate is based on cocoa butter, but does not contain cocoa solids?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: White chocolate

questions.question: Tea is made by a process called infusing.
Sweetened condensed whole milk is canned milk concentrate with molasses added to it.
Farfalle is a French word meaning butterfly.
One of Wolfgang Pucks food handlers tested positive for Hepatitis A. What was the event Puck was catering that possibly exposed hundreds of people to Hepatitis.

options.text: Playboys Playmate of the Year celebration
Sports Illustrated annual swimsuit issue party

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sports Illustrated annual swimsuit issue party

questions.question: Ganache is a fancy word for an apron.
Modern cakes were first baked in Europe around the mid-17th century. They were not frosted. Why did they start frosting cakes?

options.text: As a status symbol - because sugar was very expensive only the rich could afford a frosted cake
To add flavor since the cakes were more like breads or biscuits
To impress the King since one needed the Kings permission to open a bakery
To better preserve the cake since there was no modern refrigeration available

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: To better preserve the cake since there was no modern refrigeration available

questions.question: A marmite is a large circular sieve made with bamboo and mesh.

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Milk and Graffiti
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, people, process. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: How many calories does 1 serving (8 fl. oz.) of skim milk contain?
If you want to remove graffiti from the wall of your house, you should do it within this period of time.
Researches have found that most graffiti artists fall into this demographic category.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Males of age 12 to 21

questions.question: According to the Bureau of Justice statistics, graffiti is the most common form of this.
If police catch a graffiti offender and they are under 18, the parents will have to pay a fine, up to this amount.
Milk should not be exposed to strong light.
These are the four types of graffiti styles.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tagging, hate, gang, and generic

questions.question: This is what most graffiti artists prefer to be called.
These ancient people drew graffiti on walls and monuments.
The word graffiti comes from this language.
Which term refers to the process of dispersing milk fat throughout the milk?
Generally milk stays fresh for up to a week after the sell by or pull date.
He was one of the first New York graffiti vandals.
What percentage of water is removed from milk to make evaporated milk?
Graffiti is plural. This is the singular form.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Peanut and Cereal
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, cereal, crisp. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What characters from an animated series, did the cereal Fruity Pebbles feature as its mascot?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: Who was the creator of the “Peanuts” cartoon, that featured characters like Lucy, Linus, Snoopy and Charlie Brown?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charles Schulz

questions.question: Complete the advertising slogan of a peanut butter brand: “Choosy mothers choose ______
This world-famous manufacturer of athletic shoes has its origins in a company called Blue Ribbon Sports, founded by Phil Knight and his track coach, Bill Bowerman.
Who was the inventor of the Malian peanut sheller?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jock Brandis

questions.question: Peanuts are not considered to be nuts. They are legumes, and belong to the same class as peas and beans.
What US President was a peanut farmer from the south?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jimmy Carter

questions.question: This peanut related sandwich, common in the USA and Canada, is often served with a glass of milk.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Peanut butter and jelly

questions.question: The fabric hook-and-loop fasteners with the brand name, Velcro, were invented by Swiss engineer Georges de Mestral in what year?
This botanist taught former slaves farming techniques for self-sufficiency and is known for suggesting hundreds of uses for the peanut.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Washington Carver

questions.question: The mascot of which cereal is an animated sun, named Sunny?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Raisin Bran

questions.question: Art Paul Schlosser wrote a song about peanut butter called Have A Peanut Butter Sandwich.
What was the original mascot for the Cookie Crisp cereal?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a wizard

questions.question: This snack food company, founded in 1906, is famous for its peanuts and the Mr. Peanut icon.
Elvis Presley, who was keen on Peanut Butter and Banana sandwiches, passed away in what year?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Game and Monopoly
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, world, following. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which if the following is not among the 12 standard tokens used in Monopoly?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A kettle

questions.question: The song, Blue Suede Shoes, which is generally associated with Elvis Presley, had a massive chart success in the 1950s. Who wrote the song?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Carl Perkins

questions.question: According to the official Monopoly rules what happens if the bank runs out of money during the course of the game?

options.text: The game continues but players cannot get money from the bank anymore
The game continues - additional money can be added

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The game continues - additional money can be added

questions.question: The board game Monopoly was initially created not only for entertaining purposes but also to demonstrate this aspect of the market.

options.text: The number of opportunities private-owned properties gave people
The negatives of concentrating land in private-owned properties
The advantages of the transition from state-owned to private-owned property
The rapid shift of property in developing markets

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The negatives of concentrating land in private-owned properties

questions.question: A clog is a type of shoe, made predominantly out of leather, associated with the Netherlands.
High-heeled shoes were first invented by men around 1500s AD, with this purpose in mind.

options.text: To be used as a weapon
To keep feet from slipping out of stirrups while riding
To keep feet high and dry from horse manure

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: To keep feet from slipping out of stirrups while riding

questions.question: In L. Frank Baums story, The Wonderful Wizard of OZ, the Good Witch of the North comes with the Munchkins to greet Dorothy, and gives her ruby slippers.
The term Monopoly money has been used in popular culture to refer to which of these types of currencies?

options.text: Currencies that cannot be used to purchase services on the free market
Currencies in which each paper bill is in different color
Currencies that cannot be used to purchase goods on the free market

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: This is one of the fashion designers whose designs were included in Barbie Dolls collection of couture.
During World War 2 the game Monopoly was used by the British Secret Services for this very practical and clever purpose.

options.text: To draw away the attention of Nazi soldiers
To code secret information about key German targets and send it to GB disguised as a Monopoly game
To secretly provide prisoners of war held by the Nazis with useful objects – maps, compasses, real money, etc.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: To secretly provide prisoners of war held by the Nazis with useful objects – maps, compasses, real money, etc.

questions.question: In which of these U.S. cities did the first worldwide Monopoly championship take place?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New York

questions.question: The popular board game Monopoly is named after the economic term of the same name which refers to what market structure?

options.text: The domination of the market by a single entity
The homogenous nature of the market
The division of the market between single (mono-) owners and joint (-poly) cooperations
The politics of a government to encourage private property

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The domination of the market by a single entity

questions.question: Although the Parker Brothers company states that the right length of a Monopoly game should be about 45 minutes, the game often continues for hours because of the hard-to-reach terminating conditions. How much did  the longest Monopoly game on record last according to the toy company Hasbro (owner of Parker Brothers)?
What version of Monopoly was produced in 1978 by retailer Neiman Marcus?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chocolate Monopoly

questions.question: In the standard Monopoly game set, what is the number of the Chance cards?
